questions.question: What is the author trying to say about relationships and prejudice in this story?

choices.answer: Most relationships include some type of prejudice
A teen cannot form relationships with someone who is ethnically different
People form better relationships when they do not have prejudice
Most parents are prejudiced against teens from a diff ethnic group.

questions.question: Julio has a great love for Romiette. He is willing to risk his own life to save hers.

choices.answer: culture
humor
prejudice
devotion

questions.question: Gangs (Devildogs) separate students into groups. Prejudice separates groups from one another. What does separate mean?

choices.answer: divide
combine
prevent
protect

questions.question: "The Devildogs. They the baddest gang in the city right now," Malaka boasted. What does this show you about Malaka

choices.answer: she wants to be accepted in the gang
she's nice
she's a popular kid
she is secretly a clown in purple

questions.question: When the Devildogs confront Julio in the bathroom, the author creates a mood of---

choices.answer: friendliness
curiosity
romance
danger

questions.question: Ben's car breaking down is important because----

choices.answer: He and Destiny are not able to follow Julio and Romiette
Ben does not have the money to fix it
Destiny is embarrassed by Ben's car
Ben and Destiny get caught in the rain

questions.question: Julio and Romi are from different ethnic backgrounds, but they don't care. They fall in love. The gang doesn't approve.

choices.answer: This is the best plot summary
It's a good metaphor
This is a great exposition
It's not correct

questions.question: Mrs. Montague tells Mrs. Capelle that "their children are linked together" because--

choices.answer: she is irritated by the Cappelles' accusations of Julio
she wants the families to unite (so they can help find them)
she thinks the police are not doing a good job
she does not believe Destiny's story about the video camera

questions.question: The setting of the story shows that----

choices.answer: gangs are everywhere
people are only prejudiced in the North
teenagers are only involved in gangs in big cities
interracial relationships are more accepted in the East

questions.question: Why does Ben defend Julio after Julio punches him?

choices.answer: Ben plans to get back at Julio in another way
Ben does not have any friends
Ben knows he will also get into trouble
Ben is a nice guy, and he knows the punch was not on purpose
